citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
Proposal #176 has a rational for why the use of animals is necessary but does not have a rational for the total number of
animals to be used. The IACUC must review the rational for the proposed number of animals to be used to help minimize
the use of animals. Ensure that IACUC-approved proposals/protocols contain a rational for the number of animals to be
used so that the IACUC can review the appropriateness of the proposed animal use.
***Correct by December 22, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
CATHERINE HOVANCSAK, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist
Catherine Beckwith, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n

narrative:
2.31(e)(2) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
Proposal #176 has a rational for why the use of animals is necessary but does not have a rational for the total number of 
animals to be used. The IACUC must review the rational for the proposed number of animals to be used to help minimize 
the use of animals. Ensure that IACUC-approved  proposals/protocols contain a rational for the number of animals to be 
used so that the IACUC can review the appropriateness of the proposed animal use.  
***Correct by December 22, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
CATHERINE  HOVANCSAK, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist 
Catherine Beckwith, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n
